title: EarnOnVictor
author: EarnOnVictor
content: For starters, I am a Bitcoin enthusiast with so much adoption in HODLing, Payments and Trading and it has been a blessing to me. Despite that, what I do differently from most Bitcoiners is that I don't deceive myself, I will never be a bigot but face the reality of the situation. Thanks to my grassroots experience in the financial market, unlike those who only started during this crypto-era, the experience is so lacking and popular people can easily trick them. This is partly why Trump could deceive people this much, what a folly! To what end?Trump will do nothing in the crypto world if he succeeds in becoming the US president, he is only using Bitcoin and others to ascend to the throne. Someone who had condemned Bitcoin many times in the past but suddenly started painting himself as its messiah, don't you think this has some undertone? Why are people so gullible? Many bullish speculations are flying all over the internet to his credit, but talk is cheap and the market is not foolish, we can see the true reflection already.I like us to see beyond the deception of those who want to use Bitcoin's popularity for their gains and still later abandon it. The future of Bitcoin only lies in the hands of the true adopters, not fake ones. Don't you guys think the true adopters of Bitcoin will lead by example? How many estates, hotels and businesses of Trump are now accepting Bitcoin for payments? Or how many of his liquid assets has he converted to Bitcoin? Talk is cheap, a true Bitcoiner will surely lead by example.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Trump is a politician, and anyone who is listening to his speech and promises about what he will do for bitcoin should have it in mind that politicians primarily objective is for their own personal gain before that of the public will comes in, and aside from him being anti-Bitcoin in the past, what he is fighting for is to retake a public office and not his private organisation, where he will be the sole decision maker.

Constitution, it's reality.But let me ask you, do you think that is it coincidence that Bitcoin Spot ETFs and Ethereum Spot ETFs were approved recent months in 2024, the President Election Year?It's not coincidence, there are reasons behind it and I don't attribute it all to Trump but the fact is under pressure of US. citizens and politicians of the opposite party, the White House and Biden administration had to change, they have no choice. Attribute it to Trump, to Republic Party, you decide, I am not argue with you on it.

Regardless of what Trump looks like, I feel he has made an impact for Bitcoin. It's not a fake or genuine problem, but crypto is currently in the business industry. The ultimate goal of the majority of investors is that money is not a profitable adoption such as a means of exchange or digital money. Most have understood this condition, not many people have purely become a bitcoin adopter without thinking about profits. When a person wants to be bold or have an impact, he must have power and Trump is doing that process through election as a presidential candidate.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: I use to classify adage based on situation, and their is an old adage I will like us to reference to in this statement which goes like me this.Show me a prostitute who is a Virgin, and I will show you a politician who doesn't lie.Note this is not about lieing but a point to take cognisance of, because Trump falls under such category as a politician, take whatever promises they make during campaign as just sermon, and the real action will come when they get to office, so regardless of what Trump promised the cryptocurrency community in the bitcoin conference, still will not hold ground on the long, if he falls to act accordingly to his promise regarding cryptocurrency no one will question him, since it just campaign and not policies of government, so no evidence to prove his actions and inaction in such instances, so let not be overly concerned with his speech now and all through the campaign and election period, because that is just a tool, Trump is using to gain the interest of the citizens in his direction, so we have to come up with some more valuable discussions and try as much as possible to pay less attention to Trump or any other politicians who may deverse a means to use cryptocurrency popularity to build more votes for themselves.It's likely that we may still see the others condenders in this election employing other means aside from cryptocurrency to build that followership from the electorates, between that and bitcoin we should know that it just a means to a politician to use whatever aspects they see that is a concern and have the interest of the verse majority's to campaign with.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: If we don't vote for Trump, should we vote for the Democrats, for Harris? The one who will almost certainly continue to pursue the draconian policies toward crypto and crypto that Biden left behind? Everyone knows that the nature of politicians is to be very cunning, deceitful and even regardless of everything just to achieve their goals. Those who vote for Trump do not mean they completely trust Trump or turn him into a cult that obeys him. They voted for him as if they were betting and giving themselves a chance because if he is elected and keeps his promise, the crypto industry will have a chance to grow stronger. Meanwhile, if we vote for Harris, we have almost no chance at all. We only have 2 candidates, meaning we only have 2 options and can only choose 1 of the 2, we don't have a third choice that is better than those 2 people. That's the problem.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: It’s recognizable that his relationship with Bitcoin has been complex. He previously criticized Bitcoin, but during his 2024 speech, he praised its achievements. He even likened Bitcoin enthusiasts to historical innovators like Edison and the Wright brothers. However, actions speak louder than words.This is bout facing the reality rather than getting caught up in hype. His recent interest in Bitcoin seems more like a strategic move to gain support rather than a genuine endorsement. Given his past condemnation of Bitcoin, his sudden shift to painting himself as its champion is suspect.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: To be honest, Trump has not done anything for bitcoin and us so far, but we cannot rush to assert that he will break his promises or not deliver on what he claims if elected. Everything is still unknown, no one has the right to judge anyone at the present time when the final election results are not yet available. On the opposite side, Biden or Kamala made almost no statements related to cryptocurrency during their election campaign. That shows that no matter which Democrats are elected, they still do not want to appear as crypto-friendly as the current administration is treating the crypto industry. OP, have you checked the markets today, a recession is approaching under Biden's presidency. I don't think any of us want this situation to continue so there is no reason to continue voting for Democratic candidates.
